question.text: In an average menstrual cycle of 28 days, which of these events is correctly matched with the time of its occurrence?

options.text: Endometrium secretes nutrients for implantation:15<sup>th</sup> -28<sup>th</sup> day

solution.text:
The series of cyclic changes that take place simultaneously in the ovaries and uterine wall (endometrium) of the female reproductive tract stimulated by different concentrations of gonadotropins like FSH and LH is called the menstrual cycle. It is mainly made up of 4 phases:
Menstrual phase or Destructive phase -1st - 4th day - endometrium degenerate.
Proliferative phase or Follicular phase - 5th - 13th day - High F.S.H. level stimulates the primordial follicle to mature into the Graafian follicle.
Ovulatory phase - 14th day - the release of the ovum.
Luteal phase or secretory phase - 15th - 28th day - rise in progesterone levels and the endometrium secretes nutrients for implantation.
